definition: to give birth to a child or children
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

pinyin: du2 sheng1 zi3 nu:3 zheng4 ce4

definition: to get married and have kids/to start a family

sentences.english: China is implementing a family planning policy. So I'm the only child in my family.
sentences.chinese: 中國正在實施計劃生育政策，所以我是家中的獨生子。

sentences.english: Objective To probe into the psychological state of criminal adolescences from the single child families.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討獨生子犯罪者心理狀況。

sentences.english: People are always confusing the twins.
sentences.chinese: 人們常誤認這兩位孿生子。

sentences.english: If they firmly believe one-child policy, there will be more and more the dink.
sentences.chinese: 如果他們堅信獨生子女政策，將會有越來越多的丁克。
中國實行獨生子女政策。

sentences.english: There certainly is greater acceptance of children being born out of wedlock.
sentences.chinese: 對非婚生子女的接受程度顯然大大提高了。

sentences.english: Happiness and the absurd are two sons of the same earth.
sentences.chinese: 幸福與荒謬是同一塊土地的雙生子。

sentences.english: Neither the twins nor James knows how to spell the word.
sentences.chinese: 對雙生子和詹姆斯都不知道這個詞的拼法。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate mental health status of only-child nurses.
sentences.chinese: 目的瞭解獨生子女護士的心理健康狀況。

sentences.english: In the ideology of many ethnics, the twins have the same soul.
sentences.chinese: 在許多民族的觀念中，孿生子具有同一個靈魂。

sentences.english: The twenty-two twins twisted wrists twice on the Christmas Eve.
sentences.chinese: 二十二個孿生子在聖誕前夜擰了兩次手腕。

sentences.english: New style industrialization and urbanization are twins in the process of modernization.
sentences.chinese: 新型工業化與城鎮化是現代化進程中的一對孿生子。

sentences.english: "Only children often grow up to be self-centred, " she was quoted as saying.
sentences.chinese: 她認爲獨生子女容易以自我爲中心。

sentences.english: The incidence of injury was closely related to parental culture background and being only-child or not.
sentences.chinese: 傷害發生率與父母文化程度及是否獨生子女密切相關。

sentences.english: How to bring up the only child triggered many debates in China.
sentences.chinese: 怎樣培養好獨生子女在中國引發了許多辯論。

sentences.english: In the West the upshot has been divorce and illegitimacy.
sentences.chinese: 在西方，這種壓力導致離婚率和私生子女比例的上升。

definition: to get married and have kids/to start a family
to take a wife/to get married (man)
marriage arranged following a pregnancy/marriage necessitated by an unplanned pregnancy
to settle down and get married (of a man)/to become a recognized expert
to bear/to give birth/to grow/to rear/to bring up (children)/fertility
to get married and start a career (idiom)/to settle down/to establish oneself
